title.value: Patient-Centered Surgical Care for Children in Low and Lower-Middle Income Countries (LMICs) - A Systematic Scoping Review of the Literature
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Patient-Centered Surgical Care for Children in Low and Lower-Middle Income Countries (LMICs) - A Systematic Scoping Review of the Literature

extractions.description: This paper is a systematic scoping review that explores the adoption of patient-centered care (PCC) in pediatric surgery in low and lower-middle income countries (LMICs). The review identifies the key PCC domains implemented and highlights the geographical and methodological gaps in the literature.

type.justification: The paper conducts a systematic scoping review by collecting and analyzing empirical data from various studies on patient-centered care in LMICs, rather than developing new theoretical frameworks.
type.quote: This review aims to characterize the adoption of key PCC domains in low and lower-middle income countries (LMICs).

name.justification: The paper focuses on patient-centered care (PCC) in pediatric surgical healthcare within LMICs.
name.quote: Patient-Centered Surgical Care for Children in Low and Lower-Middle Income Countries (LMICs) - A Systematic Scoping Review of the Literature

name.justification: The research focuses specifically on pediatric surgical care within the realm of healthcare in LMICs.
name.quote: Studies exploring patient-centered care (PCC) in pediatric surgery have been disproportionately concentrated in high-income countries.

name.justification: The paper addresses global health challenges by examining pediatric surgical care in low and lower-middle income countries and identifies disparities in healthcare.
name.quote: Patient-Centered Surgical Care for Children in Low and Lower-Middle Income Countries (LMICs) - A Systematic Scoping Review of the Literature
